item.title: 2025 edition
item.description:
On January 31, 2025, the second edition of the Jeanne d’Hack CTF took place at the University of Rouen. This competition tested the skills of students through a series of varied challenges. Participants had the opportunity to tackle challenges in Cryptography, OSINT, Pwn, Reverse Engineering, Web, and Windows!

This edition brought together 150 participants divided into 55 teams, all coming to test their skills on 45 challenges.

item.title: 2024 edition
item.description:
On January 31, 2024, the first edition of the Jeanne d’Hack CTF took place at the University of Rouen. This competition tested the skills of students through a series of varied challenges. Participants had the opportunity to compete in challenges related to cryptography, OSINT, Pwn, reverse engineering, web, Windows, and hardware!

For those who wish to explore further, the GitHub for the CTF is available at this address.

We would like to express our sincere thanks to all the teams that participated in this event, to the teachers who helped us organize the CTF, and to all the members of the association.

item.title: Inscriptions
item.description:
Jeanne D’Hack CTF 2026 – Upcoming Registration Opening

The third edition of the Jeanne D’Hack CTF will be held soon. Registration will open on December 15 at 12 PM and all necessary information is detailed below.

Registration: Online and In-Person

The CTF is accessible both online and in-person.

All participants, whether playing online or on-site, must register on the CTFd platform. Those wishing to participate in person must also register through the dedicated ticketing system. As in-person spots are limited, please only reserve a ticket if you are certain you can attend.
